intro: Minuartia facchinii, commonly known as the alpine mouse-eared cress, is a low-growing, perennial flowering plant native to the alpine regions of Europe. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with small, cross-shaped flowers. The plant typically has dense, mat-forming foliage with small, oval leaves and produces clusters of yellow or white flowers in the summer. It thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to harsh, high-altitude environments. Minuartia facchinii is often found in mountainous areas and is known for its resilience to cold and poor soil conditions.
